title: Data Pipeline for E-commerce Analytics

problem.description: A growing e-commerce had data scattered across Shopify, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, and a custom CRM. Reports were manual and took days. Cross-platform analysis or calculating complex metrics like LTV was impossible.
painPoints: Data in 4 different systems, no unified view
Weekly reports required manual CSV exports and Excel merging
Impossible to calculate LTV, CAC or other strategic metrics
Marketing decisions based on partial or outdated data

constraints.budget: Medium budget, focus on quick ROI
technical: API rate limits of third-party platforms
Limited internal technical team (1 junior developer)

solution.architecture: Cloud-native data pipeline: Fivetran for ingestion from Shopify/GA/FB Ads → BigQuery as data warehouse → dbt for transformations → Metabase for visualization. Airflow for orchestration and scheduling.
keyDecisions: Fivetran for ingestion (no-code, reliable) instead of custom scrapers
BigQuery for storage (pay-per-query, scalable, zero maintenance)
dbt for data modeling (SQL, version control, testable)
Metabase for BI (self-service, doesn't require dedicated data analyst)
solution.approach: Incremental implementation: week 1-2 = infrastructure setup + first source (Shopify), week 3-4 = add GA and FB Ads + first metrics, week 5-6 = complex dbt models (LTV, cohorts) + team training.

metrics.label: Marketing ROI
metrics.description: Campaign optimization thanks to better data

results.impact: The marketing team now makes decisions based on real-time and complete data. They identified 3 high-LTV customer segments previously ignored, and optimized ad budget by cutting non-performing channels. Pipeline ready for ML/predictive analytics.

role: Data modeling with dbt (schema, transformations, tests)
Metabase dashboard creation with strategic KPIs
